title: Change Kindred's name to Lamb
body:
Ya'll know why. {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-popcorn}}

Everything about Kindred revolves around Lamb. Even the ultimate is called Lamb's Respite.

Heck, many people refer to Kindred as ''her''.

# #reworkKindredtoBeMoreThematicallySatisfying

replies.body: A better alternative would be to rework Kindred so that Wolf and Lamb are equally represented in their kit and visual design. I don't see that happening anytime soon since they are relatively "new" and there are other champs who need VGUs more desperately. Maybe something along the lines of Aatrox's gameplay rework with a few model tweaks would be appropriate, but even then, Aatrox is 5 years old and Kindred is only 3 years old.
holy crap I can't believe Aatrox is 5 years old already.  Now I feel old...

Same here man. I every champ after Elise (which is when I started playing) feels "new" to me. For instance, I forget that Azir and Gnar were released before the new Summoner's Rift even though they still feel "modern" to me.

Same for me, except about Quinn.  She was the first new champ I saw.  It's gonna be weird for me when they start price reducing champions that I saw the release of... almost as weird as them getting VGU's!
I could see Kindred working as a transformation champ.

Same. In fact, when Kindred was being teased, I was hyped that we'd get another transforming champion since we hadn't had one since Quinn or Jayce (If you don't count Quinn/Valor). All the Kindred teasers were hinting at a duality so I really thought it'd be and R transformation champ like Mid or Jayce. I can understand Riot wanting to try something new and to be fair they did end up successfully creating a new way to express a duality in a champion with Kayn/Rhaast.  However, as it stands, Wolf doesn't have autonomy. He's like a particle effect with a bit of a personality. He's like a fancier version of Lulu's pix or SG Ahri's Kiko. In fact, he's seems like less of an individual character than Tibbers or Willump (Maybe even Skarl) imo.
Fun fact, we almost, ALMOST named them "Kindred, the Lamb and the Wolf" instead of "Kindred, the Eternal Hunters"
that would've been like naming darius "darius, the angry yelling axe man"

Faux! I know this probably isn't your department or area of expertise, but would there be any way you could talk to a Rioter or two about the possibility of renaming "Quinn" back to "Quinn and Valor" like she was on the PBE during her release? According to Morello, the reason they had to shorten the champion's name originally was due to it being several words in length (source linked below):

https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/18ys5s/quinn_and_valor_ama/c8jvue5/

However, we now have champions in the game with multi-word names, such as Tahm Kench, which means this probably wouldn't be much of an issue anymore. If there's any chance you could look into this on behalf of all Quinn (and Valor) enthusiasts, I'd greatly appreciate it!!

And the W is called "Wolfs frenzy",while the passive and E use both characters.
I was talking about this with a couple of friends, we agreed that it felt like 90% of Kindred was Lamb. It's like Wolf is simply W. That's it. It doesn't feel like Wolf is doing anything else.
I remember when Quinn was called Quinn & Valor to try and reinforce the whole multi champion thing. One of these days they'll make a multi character champion work.
Kled and skaarl work well  along with kayn and rhaast.

Kayn and Rhaast is just Kayn A and Kayn B.

Kled and Skaarl almost work, but it still mostly just feels like Kled and worse Kled.
Fingers crossed for Nunu & Willump
I agree due to the other examples like Kled and Quinn but Lamb just isn't a good name

I would dislike it if they reworked the champion kit. It's a well done kit, however it's been watered down. I pretty much play nothing but {{champion:203}}  (and Swain, but I suck at him....I envy his coat D: ). If Riot changed up their kit I would be very upset, though I do wish they'd go back to % HP passive.
